abstract: Medtronic, based in Minneapolis, said it would pay $816 million in cash for China Kanghui, a manufacturer of orthopedic devices.
snippet: Medtronic, based in Minneapolis, said it would pay $816 million in cash for China Kanghui, a manufacturer of orthopedic devices.
lead_paragraph: Medtronic, a medical technology company based in Minneapolis and listed in New York, said on Thursday that it would pay $816 million in cash to acquire China Kanghui, a manufacturer of orthopedic devices based in the eastern Chinese city of Changzhou and also listed in New York.

headline.main: Medtronic to Buy Chinese Medical Supplier
